li.a:
II. The First Quebec Conference
(August 14–24, 1943)
and Related Conversations at Hyde Park and Washington
(August 12–14 and September 1–12, 1943)
4. Agenda and Arrangements for the Conference (Documents 164–207)
A. The war in Asia and the Pacific (Documents 209–218)
B. The war in Europe and the Mediterranean (Documents 219–234)
C. Special questions relating to Italy: peace feelers, surrender terms, declaration of Rome as an open city (Documents 235–306)
F. The Soviet Union and the war (Documents 316–318)
G. Cooperation with the United Kingdom in research on atomic energy (Documents 319–337)
H. Creation of the Joint War Aid Committee, United States–Canada (Documents 338–345)
I. Representation on the Combined Food Board (Document 346)
J. Possible recognition of the French Committee of National Liberation (Documents 347–355)
L. Issuance of an Anglo-American statement on Palestine (Document 357)
P. Italian territorial questions and the political reconstruction of Italy (Document 368)
